titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Veljko Bulajić Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by Andrea Feldman and Richard Szary

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 10:57

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection consists of transcripts of interviews conducted by Veljko Bulajić, a Yugoslav filmmaker, in preparation for a television biography of Josip Broz Tito. There are also a few transcripts for interviews conducted by others. The collection also contains copies of photographs from various repositories of Tito or important people, places, and events in his life.

langmaterial.language: The interview transcripts are in Croatian.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Veljko Bulajić Collection (MS 1689). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in two series: I. Interview Transcripts, 1953, 1970, 1973-1977. II. Photographs, ca. 1914-1967.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of transcripts of interviews conducted by Veljko Bulajić, a Yugoslav filmmaker, in preparation for a television biography of Josip Broz Tito. There are also a few transcripts for interviews conducted by others. The collection also contains copies of photographs from various repositories of Tito or important people, places, and events in his life.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists primarily of carbon copies of transcripts of interviews that Veljko Bulajić conducted with Josip Broz Tito and his colleagues. Many of the transcripts contain handwritten annotations and editing. While Bulajić conducted most of the interviews, there are also a few from other sources, apparently collected by him. There is also one published statement included (by Krsto Popivoda). All of the transcripts are in Croatian.

did.unittitle: Galogaža, Hermina (5 pages), [interviewer: Ljubo (Šikić?), includes statement by Mate Matok]
Krajger, Sergej (15 pages), [interview in Slovenian with Croatian translation]
Norodom Sihanuk, H.R.H. (3 pages), [translated from French; includes statement of Stjepan Jovelić]
Orović, Savo (6 pages), [includes 2 page description of photographs and interview with Filip Pavešić, 1974 Feb 21 (2 pages)]
Published statement concerning his behavior with the police and in court, 1970.
Rajter, Jaša (24 pages), [interviewer: Ljubo (Šikić?); also includes statement of Krsto Popivoda (6 pages)]
Smirnov, Vladimir (12 pages), [interviewer: Šikić. Translated into Serbian from Russian. Includes "Tito's Memoirs" Marko Špogarić (1 page)]
Stipetić, Milutin (4 pages), [handwritten with hand-drawn map]
Tito, Josip Broz (14 pages), [Interviewer: Slava Ogrizović]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains photographs related to Josip Broz Tito assembled by Veljko Bulajić. The photographs appear to be copies of images from various repositories; there are no original images. While many of the images are of Tito, a significant portion are of people, places, and events important in his career but in which he does not appear.

did.unittitle: Tito at his desk and at unidentified event
Serbia and the Balkans during World War I

Inter-war period [includes Lenin speaking at an international rally in St. Petersburg (1920 Jul 19), members of the Yugoslav RKP(b) in Moscow (1921 Apr 10), and a group of Russian Civil War participants from Yugoslavia in Riga, 1921]
Trade union activities [copies of documents and one photograph]
Photographs and documents concerning the trial of Tito in Zagreb
Signing of the proclamation of the SFR Yugoslavia
Tito and the Executive Committee of the CC CPJ, Ljubljana
First Conference of the Non-Aligned Movement, Belgrade
Tito at the General Assembly of the UN
Buildings in Zagreb and other cities(?)
Photographs of Palmiro Togliatti, Vladko Maček, Pentkenukjehev, and D.Z. Manuilski
